definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Conclusion Heavy-moxibustion is a good method for constipation after stroke.
sentences.chinese: 結論重灸法是治療中風後便祕的良好方法。

sentences.english: I take much solace in the fact that she has been recovering from her stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她中風後一直在康復中，這讓我大感安慰。

sentences.english: He died of a stroke, same as Grandma.
sentences.chinese: 和外婆一樣，他也是患中風死的。

sentences.english: She was bed-ridden after small successive strokes;
sentences.chinese: 在接連的小中風後她臥牀不起。

sentences.english: But Tobey again stroke, good times don't last long, no chance of recovery.
sentences.chinese: 但好景不長，託比再度中風，再無康復的可能了。

sentences.english: The Oct. 2 stroke was not Wilson's first cerebral episode.
sentences.chinese: 10月2日的中風並非威爾遜的第一次腦血管意外。

sentences.english: This paper summarized professor Wang Zuo's experience in the treatment of acute hemorrhagic apoplexy.
sentences.chinese: 總結王左教授對急性出血性中風的認識。

sentences.english: Dislodgement of clot can lead to embolic phenomena, including stroke.
sentences.chinese: 血凝塊移除可導致栓賽現象，包括腦中風。

sentences.english: The increased likelihood of strokes is just one acute example.
sentences.chinese: 中風可能性的增加就是一個深刻的例子。

sentences.english: Doctor Lee had a storke last weekend.
If you have high blood pressure, you will be more susceptible to a heart attack or stroke.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有血壓高，你會更容易受到心臟病發作或中風。
規格適用中風超過300毫米。

sentences.english: To discuss the treatment to post-apoplexy depression with acupuncture of strengthening brain and regulating mind.
sentences.chinese: 探討健腦調神針法對中風後抑鬱症的治療作用。

sentences.english: The player takes his or her first stroke at the teeing ground.
sentences.chinese: 玩家需要他或她第一次中風後，在實地劃定。

sentences.english: Also, it can prevent old people from several diseases such as apoplexy, varicosity and etc.
sentences.chinese: 同時，可預防中風及靜脈曲張等多種老年疾病。

sentences.english: My father's hand, elegant as typescript, before his stroke.
sentences.chinese: 我父親的手，在他中風之前曾經像打印文字般優雅。

definition: to recur (of a disease)/to reappear/to relapse (into a former bad state)
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
